snippet: The latest campaign filings showed a crucial source of support for Mitt Romney, as well as his ability to win substantial support from some of the Republican Party’s most influential and wealthy patrons.
abstract: Campaign filings reveal that close to 60 corporations and wealthy donors gave checks of $100,000 or more to a 'super PAC' supporting Mitt Romney in the months leading up to the Iowa caucuses, underwriting a $17 million advertising blitz that has swamped his Republican rivals in the early primary states; show Romney's ability to win substantial backing from a small number of his party's most influential and wealthy patrons, each contributing to the super PAC far more than the $2,500 check each could legally write to his campaign.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MICHAEL LUO
byline.contributor: Derek Willis and Griff Palmer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The latest campaign filings showed a crucial source of support for Mitt Romney, as well as his ability to win substantial support from some of the Republican Party’s most influential and wealthy patrons.

headline.seo: Campaign Finance Reports Show ‘Super PAC’ Donors
headline.main: G.O.P. Donors Showing Thirst to Oust Obama in November
headline.print_headline: Romney Gains Strong Backing In Rich Patrons
